Posts.Content: Pinkprincess wrote: I was told at the beginning of process to get the genetic test done and I did. I did however have a different than normal yes or no BRAC result. I have a mutation that only 9 others in the world have shown to date and they aren't sure what if any significance it is. My father was tested and he is normal, my mom was just tested last week, unsure of her result. I was just wondering if anyone else on the boards had something similar? By HIS wounds, I AM HEALED!!!!! heathersknockingoutcancer.blogspot.com/ Dx 7/17/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 3/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Genetic mutation shared by only 9 others tested Pinkprincess Pinkprincess

Posts.Content: Pinkprincess wrote: Hello all ! Just wanted to start the thread for all of us entering radiation in the month of May. I finished chemo on February 28th and had delayed reconstruction with tissue expansion placement on March 16. I have been filling FAST since then to be fully expanded before rads. I have one more fill, if I can stand it, on Tuesday and my rads simulation on Wednesday. Then they follow up again on Friday to make sure everything is perfect and then BOOM....we start rads on the 25th of April. 28 regs and 5 boosts for a grand total of 33. So, that is my story...what's yours? By HIS wounds, I AM HEALED!!!!! heathersknockingoutcancer.blogspot.com/ Dx 7/17/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 3/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal

Posts.Content: Pinkprincess wrote: Hello dear ladies, I have been doing weekly Taxol and started out on high doses of dexamathasomething.....and was weaned down after 2 treatments to 4mg at infusion. After the lowered dose I started noticing some mild itching in the evening after the treatment, no rash just itching, reported it to np and she put me back on 4mg nite before and 10mg with infusion. I have been gaining weight like crazy since. My stomach looks like I am four months pregnant, and I have 5 more weeks to go. My question is is there a way to avoid the weight gain...drink more water, limit salt, anything? If not, who has gained while on the steroids and how long does it take to go away? HELP!!!! By HIS wounds, I AM HEALED!!!!! heathersknockingoutcancer.blogspot.com/ Dx 7/17/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 3/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Pinkprincess wrote: Hello all ! Just wanted to start the thread for all of us entering radiation in the month of May. I finished chemo on February 28th and had delayed reconstruction with tissue expansion placement on March 16. I have been filling FAST since then to be fully expanded before rads. I have one more fill, if I can stand it, on Tuesday and my rads simulation on Wednesday. Then they follow up again on Friday to make sure everything is perfect and then BOOM....we start rads on the 25th of April. 28 regs and 5 boosts for a grand total of 33. So, that is my story...what's yours? By HIS wounds, I AM HEALED!!!!! heathersknockingoutcancer.blogspot.com/ Dx 7/17/2010, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 3/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal
